solution.text:
Given pair of equations are:
_{i}_x + _{j}_y = _{{7*j}}_ and _{{3*i}}_x + _{{3*j}}_y = _{{9*j}}_.
_{i}_x + _{j}_y - _{{7*j}}_ = 0 -------(1)
_{{3*i}}_x + _{{3*j}}_y - _{{9*j}}_ = 0 -------(2)
Comparing with general equations, we get:
\(a_1 = _{i}_ ,a_2 = _{{3*i}}_ ,b_1 = _{j}_ ,b_2 = _{{3*j}}_ ,c_1 = -_{{7*j}}_, c_2 = -_{{9*j}}_\)
Here:
i.e., \({a_1\over a_2} = {b_1\over b_2} = {1\over 3}, {c_1\over c_2} = {7\over 9}\)
i.e., \({a_1\over a_2} = {b_1\over b_2} \neq {c_1\over c_2}\)
Hence, given pair of lines have no solution, which means that they are parallel lines

content.text:
Following are the pair of equation of two lines.Comment whether they are parallel, coincident or intersecting lines.
_{i}_x + _{j}_y = _{{7*j}}_ and _{{3*i}}_x + _{{3*j}}_y = _{{9*j}}_.
